newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan's Getz Bros buys 43% of Customflex's shares.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Getz Bros buys 43% of Customflex's shares.

text.p: Japan's Getz Bros Co Ltd said on Tuesday that it had acquired 43 percent of British medical equipment company Customflex Ltd's shares.
Getz Bros, which imports medical supplies and equipment, said it had acquired 189,500 shares in Customflex.
Customflex develops and produces artificial joints, such as those for the knee and the ankle, Getz Bros said in a statement.
The acquisition will enable Getz Bros to expand its operations into the handling of orthopaedics equipment, as well as obtain the latest medical information from Europe, the company said.
The share purchase will not affect the company's earnings forecast for the current business year ending on December 31, it said.
